intro: Lindernia pyxidaria var. grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora lindernia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces violet to purple flowers that are typically borne in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for container gardening. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
